start.speaker: Captain Aldric
start.text: Erwin. You're the new initiate, aren't you? I've read your file. Decent marks in training, nothing exceptional. But marks don't make a guardsman.

choices.text: I'm ready to prove myself, Captain.
What does make a guardsman, then?

eager_response.speaker: Captain Aldric
eager_response.text: Eager. Good. Eagerness can get you killed, but it's better than the alternative. I have something for you — your first real task.

question_response.speaker: Captain Aldric
question_response.text: A fair question. Loyalty. Judgment. Knowing when to follow orders and when to think for yourself. The second one will get you in trouble someday.

choices.text: When would thinking for myself be appropriate?

neutral_response.speaker: Captain Aldric
neutral_response.text: Duty. Yes. We'll see how you handle it. I have a task for you.

philosophy_response.speaker: Captain Aldric
philosophy_response.text: When the order is wrong, and you know it's wrong, and following it would make you something you don't want to be. But be careful — that's a judgment call, and you won't always be right.

first_mission_offer.speaker: Captain Aldric
first_mission_offer.text: There's been a theft in the castle. Nothing valuable — just some silver candlesticks from the chapel. But theft is theft, and the priests are upset. Find out who did it. Report back to me. Don't make accusations without evidence.

mission_hint.speaker: Captain Aldric
mission_hint.text: The servants have access. So do some of the lesser nobles who use the chapel. And there's always the tunnels — though officially, we don't talk about those. Start with questions. Watch who gets nervous.

mission_report.speaker: Captain Aldric
mission_report.text: You're back. What have you found?

choices.text: I believe Mira the servant took them, but she needed the money for medicine.
The servant Mira is the thief. I have evidence.

still_investigating.speaker: Captain Aldric
still_investigating.text: Then why are you here? Go. Investigate.

accuse_mira_sympathetic.speaker: Captain Aldric
accuse_mira_sympathetic.text: Medicine, you say. Hmm. The priests want justice. But justice isn't always punishment. I could... lose the report. The candlesticks could reappear. No one needs to know. Is that what you're asking?

choices.text: Yes. She made a mistake, but she's not a criminal.
No, the law is the law. She must face consequences.

accuse_mira_direct.speaker: Captain Aldric
accuse_mira_direct.text: Evidence. Good. She'll be dismissed, possibly imprisoned. The priests will be satisfied. You've done your duty, Erwin.

cover_up_ending.speaker: Captain Aldric
cover_up_ending.text: You have a conscience. That's... complicated. But not unwelcome. I'll handle this quietly. The candlesticks will find their way back. Now go — and forget we had this conversation.

strict_ending.speaker: Captain Aldric
strict_ending.text: The law is the law. You're right, of course. I'll have her brought in. Justice will be served.

greeting_allied.speaker: Captain Aldric
greeting_allied.text: Erwin. Good to see you. What brings you to me today?

choices.text: Do you have any work for me?

casual_chat.speaker: Captain Aldric
casual_chat.text: Checking in. Good instinct. A guard who keeps his commander informed is a guard who stays alive. Anything to report?

request_work.speaker: Captain Aldric
request_work.text: Always more work than men to do it. Let me see what needs doing...
